column4: i'm trying to replace the default window manager to compiz :)
Shirakawasuna fallback to gnome 3 is like unity 2d to unity
Shirakawasuna to gnome shell i mean
you wouldn't happen to know how to set compiz to be the default window manager in gnome-session-fallback would you? I ended up moving /usr/bin/metacity and softlinking compiz *hangs head in shame*
well how did you change to awesome as default?
theres a method that uses gconf-tool
do you happen to know whereabouts in gconf-editor? or could point me to a tutorial
you mean how to set default wm or a general guide ?
open gconf-editor then go to /desktop/gnome/session/required_components . theres an entry called "windowmanager" in there
is this 11.10? /desktop/gnome has no session folder
dont know if it still works. i use gnome shell as default then switch to awesome
creating teh folders and field won't explode my system if i give it a shot?
the computer wont explode but that will have no effect

that's interesting. the folder ~/.gconf/desktop/gnome/applications/window_manager already exists with a %gconf.xml file in it with the correct window manager. this doesn't appear in gconf-editor though. any ideas why?
sorry but idk about those stuffs
